summary.para: Test if point is located in the epsilon neighborhood of the line.

Epsilon neighborhood is defined by a GeometRi3D.Tolerance property.
Test if point is located in the epsilon neighborhood of the object.
Epsilon neighborhood is defined by a GeometRi3D.Tolerance property.

member.name: M:GeometRi.Rotation.FromEulerAngles(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.String,GeometRi.Coord3d)
member.summary:
Creates rotation object by composing three elemental rotations, i.e. rotations about the axes of a coordinate system.
Both proper Euler angles ("xyx", "zxz", etc.) or TaitBryan angles ("xyz", "yzx") are allowed. Extrinsic rotations (rotations in fixed frame) should be written in lower case ("xyz", zxz", etc.).
Intrinsic rotations (rotations in moving frame) should be written in upper case ("XYZ", "ZXZ", etc.).
member.param: String, representing rotation axes in the form "xyz" (extrinsic rotations, fixed frame) or "XYZ" (intrinsic rotations, moving frame).

member.name: M:GeometRi.Rotation.ToEulerAngles(System.String,GeometRi.Coord3d)
member.summary:
Factor a rotation matrix as product of three elemental rotations, i.e. rotations about the axes of a coordinate system.
Both proper Euler angles ("xyx", "zxz", etc.) or TaitBryan angles ("xyz", "yzx") are allowed. Extrinsic rotations (rotations in fixed frame) should be written in lower case ("xyz", zxz", etc.).
Intrinsic rotations (rotations in moving frame) should be written in upper case ("XYZ", "ZXZ", etc.). Note that such factorization generally is not unique!
member.param: String, representing rotation axes in the form "xyz" (extrinsic rotations, fixed frame) or "XYZ" (intrinsic rotations, moving frame).
member.returns: Double array with first, second and third rotation angles

summary.para: Test if segment is located in the epsilon neighborhood of the line.
Epsilon neighborhood is defined by a GeometRi3D.Tolerance property.
For relative tolerance tests a fraction of the segment's length is used to define epsilon neighborhood.
